properties.areaDesc: Western Columbia River Gorge; Western Columbia River Gorge
properties.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued January 17 at 9:39PM PST until January 18 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Significant icing expected. Ice accumulations will vary
depending on location within the Gorge. No ice accumulations are
expected near the west end of the Gorge. There may be a narrow
ribbon of one tenth to one quarter of an inch of freezing rain
near Cascade Locks, but the heaviest ice accumulations appear
most likely to fall above river level. Precipitation appears
more likely to fall as snow early tonight around Cascade Locks
where 1 to 3 inches of snow will be possible before
precipitation turns to all rain Saturday morning.

* WHERE...Western Columbia River Gorge.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 8 AM Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Avoid unnecessary travel through the Columbia River
Gorge tonight into Saturday morning.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures are slightly warmer than
anticipated this evening in the Gorge. In addition, temperatures
aloft appear increasingly likely to support more snow than
freezing rain so confidence that significant freezing rain
accumulations will occur has decreased. We will monitor
temperature trends for a few more hours before adjusting the
forecast further.
properties.instruction:
Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra
flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an
emergency. Prepare for possible power outages.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: ICE STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST SATURDAY
